tweets.text:
Illegal nets and traps endanger wildlife. 

Fishery officers were recently called to this illegal net on a lake in the South East – the fish were returned unharmed.

If you see signs of illegal fishing, call our incident hotline on 0800 807060 so our officers can investigate. https://t.co/joOZdWQAXx

Video will be up later, this is just 1 of 1000's of areas nationally. Part of the reason why our rivers are a disgrace. What appeared to be sewage fungus looked vile underwater.
#sewage #Pollution #environment #wipes #freshwater https://t.co/mOTTpJpAcG

A week ago, oil pollution began entering the Peak Forest Canal at Furness Vale. We contacted @CanalRiverTrust EVERY DAY. After 5 days of inaction we went public to get them to take it seriously. We thought they had, but a week later the spill is spreading and worsening. 1/3 https://t.co/tD9bGkkFik

domain.name: Interests and Hobbies Vertical

tweets.text:
"The voice of being prepared for climate change and nature's recovery" - What is the role of the Environment Agency? @EmmaHowardBoyd, Chair of the @EnvAgency, explains it all to @MLiebreich

🎙️ Listen & watch now: https://t.co/2EFmNbo67J https://t.co/nBkY8fLCex

tweets.text: @SpudSlingsby @farmerkaney @loosecollie @EnvAgency @DaveThroupEA @dredgetherivers I remember the time when the NRA kept our Upper Thames tributary brooks flowing. In those days we had the occasional floods, now it’s far to often. Apparently it prevents built up areas flooding downstream, shouldn’t have built houses on low lying land.

This week @northyorkmoors have planted 500 trees in Danby Dale as part of the #WEG Esk Restoration Project. The trees will help reduce sediment & runoff from the land, improving water quality AND will create new woodland habitat. 🌳👍 @EnvAgencyYNE https://t.co/9mQNMIgMi4

tweets.text:
We have a number of flood alerts & warnings in place across parts of the #Midlands

👉Do not drive through #flood water – 30 cms could float your car

👉Latest information on #flood warnings: https://t.co/4HSc5MbL20 https://t.co/bXN6JUkiWq

Even if someone you hire fly tips your waste – you’ll end up with a fine. Before you hire a waste disposal service ask for their Waste Carrier Licence number, a receipt and where they dispose of waste. Check this information on the @EnvAgency website. 

#KeepKentClean https://t.co/Q5gGDzOI55
@Bryanb78918117 @EnvAgency Shocking And disgusting still whilst no one does anything they’ll carry on. Anglers are going to take things into their own hands eventually

Teaching my boys and Monty the puppy about #NFM and @LeedsFAS  today! I thought I would share a little bit with you guys too! This is at the upper end of the Wortley catchment SW Leeds. @EnvAgencyYNE @Leeds_Highways @LeedsCC_News @YorkshireiCASP https://t.co/NSglImjsKE

@farmerkaney @loosecollie @EnvAgency @DaveThroupEA @dredgetherivers The EA forget that they used to be called the National Rivers Authority, tasked with maintaining rivers. You don't maintain something by neglecting it

urls.title: Illegal landfill sites along rivers in the Balkans are causing an ecology disaster
urls.description: Unreported Europe takes a look at how rubbish is ending up in rivers in Bosnia & Herzegovina, Serbia, and Montenegro. Environmentalists have condemn this situation, which has been happening for the last 25 years. #UnreportedEurope

tweets.text:
Rivers in 🇧🇦, 🇷🇸 and 🇲🇪 have been continuously contaminated for quarter of a century.

Each year, between 6.000 and 8.000 cubic meters of waste are collected on the Drina river.

These floating landfills cause irreversible harm on the local #biodiversity.

https://t.co/Uj8JZOKS2s

Kingfishers need to eat their own bodyweight in fish & aquatic insects each day. Our #StaffsSUNRISE work on the Trent & its tributaries is improving habitat for fish and insects - helping the kingfisher enjoy an abundant diet! Filmed at Milton by @TalesofaWildGuy 
@EnvAgencyMids https://t.co/MzxiykaHUb
@EnvAgency It’s hard to trust Eastern European anglers but I’m sure they’re not all this ignorant?

Trees, hedgerows, fencing and sediment traps have been introduced to farms in the Esk Catchment as part of the Water Environment Grant (WEG) Esk Restoration Project. 

We will continue to work with @northyorkmoors, to deliver the project in spring 2021. 

#northyorkshire https://t.co/JFPLxwjJwK
